awd_titl_txt: Surface Chemistry of Palladium Monolayers and Thin Films
awd_abstract_narration: This project is in the general area of analytical and surface                   chemistry and in the subfield of heterogeneous catalysis.  The                  principal investigator will deposit palladium monolayers and                    multilayer thin films on single crystal tantalum surfaces and                   study the altered surface chemical properties of these                          overlayers.  The work will focus on correlating changes in                      adsorption/desorption kinetics, chemisorption bond strength and                 reactivity with geometric and electronic structure of the                       palladium overlayer.  Critical data will be obtained by high                    resolution electron energy loss spectroscopy and ion scattering                 spectrometry.                                                                                                                                                   These fundamental studies are expected to produce new chemical                  insight into the design of materials with new and unique surface                properties and to aid the atomic level explanation of the                       selectivity of alloy and bimetallic cluster catalysts which are                 important in the petroleum industry.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
